alert.note: Alert for Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 4:31PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Huerfano and northeastern Custer Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 431 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Junkins Burn Scar, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Junkins Burn Scar, Silver Cliff and Rosita. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft
